meanings.definition: The quality or state of being reactive.
meanings.sent1: Her reactivity to the situation was impressive, showing how quickly she responded.
meanings.sent2: The reactivity of the chemicals in the experiment was carefully monitored.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reactivity to the laser pointer provided endless entertainment for the family.
meanings.sent4: His reactivity to stress was like a volcano ready to erupt at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The reactivity of the fire alarm made sure everyone evacuated the building quickly.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a substance to undergo chemical reactions.
meanings.sent1: The reactivity of the metal made it perfect for use in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the reactivity of elements to understand their behavior in reactions.
meanings.sent3: The reactivity of the baking soda with vinegar created a fun science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The reactivity of the solution was like a dance of molecules coming together.
meanings.sent5: The reactivity of the acid with the metal produced a dramatic fizzing reaction.
